description: Back formation from oration, from Latin ōrātiō (“speech, discourse, oration”), from ōrātus (“spoken, orated”), from ōrō (“speak, pray”).

adjectives.description: orate (comparative more orate, superlative most orate)

entries.meaning: Competent in oracy; having good speaking skills.

verbs.description: orate (third-person singular simple present orates, present participle orating, simple past and past participle orated)

entries.meaning: To speak formally; to give a speech.
To speak passionately; to preach for or against something.
